column4: HELP  I have no SUDO. I probably accidently distroyed my /etc/hosts . any ideas on how to recover it ?
do you have /etc/sudoers ?
looking
try dpkg-reconfigure sudo
I dont have /etc/sudoers
the dpkg must b run as root
definitely try `dpkg-reconfigure sudo`
hmmm... yeah.  haha
ok, how is that done? have no root priv (having no sudo...)
that's tough.  might have to reboot into single-user mode.
I'll try, thanx!
ok I have /etc/sudoers and still have the same sudo problem. I do belive I destroyed my /etc/hosts...
r u with me?
sorry, was working on something.  you don't have an /etc/hosts file?
got help from _jason , working on it, thanx!
oh, cool.  was it /etc/hosts ?

_jason : ok, the sudo problem is fixed (adding the localhost to /etc/host) but that's the only line I have there. shouldn't there be anything else (it used to be much longer filled with fe00:: ... and so on
_jason last problem for this evening: when I unmount my usb-disk its link-light does not go off. any ideas?
i don't know for sure about that... my guess is that when you dismount it linux is leaving the power to the port on.
mine's the same way in linux.
how can u tell it was umounted correctly?
`mount` or `tail /var/log/syslog` or `dmesg` ?
_jason I'll appreciate u taking look at this outputs (after 'umount /media/Flash_disk/) http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/10997
